description: Episode of Series "Mirror of Germany. The German Scene = Deutschland Spiegel". Magazine items: The Hamburg State Opera celebrates its 300th anniversary; equality of women is a basic right guaranteed by the German Contitution; the Vischering Castle in Westphalia is one of the most beautiful and best preserved; at the Hansa pit in the Rhur district coal is mined soley by hydraulic power; at the Roman-Germanic Museum at the foot of Cologne Cathedral, the prople of the city can study their own past. A centre for senior citizens was built at great expense in a Hamburg suburb as an example to other parts of Germany and the World Skiing Championships at Garmisch-Partenkirchen brought some unexpected successes.
